p: Alzheimer’s disease (AD) is known as an epidemic problem throughout the world. It is one of the frequent forms of dementia disorder with progressive synaptic damage and neuronal degeneration ( 1, 2). There is a progressive increase in the prevalence of AD especially in ageing people such that about %4 of the populations have AD over the age of 65 and %47 after 85 years of age ( 3). The World Alzheimer Report in 2016 reported that about 47 million people are bearing physical, psychological, and behavioral problems related to AD, creating a heavy economic burden for both societies and healthcare providers ( 4).
